Fidgeting.

Doesn't bother with crude if totalScaling is less than 3.5 (seems like a
decent number).

Won't use crude rendering if zoom is greater than 3.5 OR LESS THAN 1.0.
That makes a little more sense.

Okay, now it uses crude rendering if it's zoomed more than 3.5, less
than 1.0, or hasn't zoomed at all (zooming equals 1.0).

Not rerendering in zoomed out area. Not perfect but it's not that nice
an effect. Doesn't line up nicely. Giving up on it for now.

Compromise - won't do crude render if you've only zoomed out a little
(totalScaleFactor must be less than 0.8 to trigger crude). Not sure how
good this is but we'll see.

Doesn't crash on saving/restoring instance state (some stupid bit of
code got left in from I don't even know when). Might come back to it and
let it save/reload the location, but that's for later.

them sitting doing nothing.

Removed setScaledIterationCount because it was never actually running.
Trying to simplify that code a bit.

Removed getScaledIterationCount because it wasn't ever running either. I

Anyway, don't seem to need them in this version.

Detail controls working! Though I keep finding myself going to

And I think I should increase the range.

Increased the range. To change it, change the DETAIL_DIVISOR and default
detail constants in AbstractFractalView (change the default to keep it
in the same place with the range - default/divisor = 0.3 works well).

Removed the contrast variables from mjlocation. Don't need them (and
haven't for a long while, now that I understand that system).

Schedules crude render if you didn't complete the last render,
regardless of how much you zoomed (so will do crude after, say, a big
zoom that doesn't finish rendering and then a little zoom).

Not crashing when Julia does save/restoreInstanceState. Still need to
store the pin coords.
Everything now restores properly if any activities are forced to close.

Chnaged phrasing on menu to Add/Remove rather than Hide/Show. I think it
makes it a little clearer that the Julia position won't persist.
Grouped save and share menu options together into one.

Added basic info text at start. Also took forever getting a link in the
about text. It works okay, though the whole textview flashes drak if you
click it.
Reasonably happy with the basic intro text now.

Happy with intro text, set it to only run on first time. Added basic
help text, still drafting it.
Happy with the help text now.
Just deleted a bunch of branches, and some code tidying.

Added long click listener to set Julia (needs a little tweaking to open
it if it's not open). Also fixed the crude rendering, which was broken
because I was always setting completedLastRender to false before
checking it. Dumbass.

Bug fixing. New pin won't drop if dragging or already holding pin (or
scaling, but that was in before).

There seems to be an intermittent bug where pin gets half-selected but
doesn't drag, just stays big and can't be dragged further. Set
holdingPin to false when adding new little view, so at least removing
and re-adding the little view should fix it. Maybe.

Also removed logging that was happening every time the pin moved at all,
which made it a fair bit less laggy.

Fixed that bug where the pin was staying selected but the fractal was
being dragged. Disabled currentlyDragging after longClick is called the
first time and pin is dropped. Means you can move your finger around
after dropping the pin and nothing happens. Maybe slightly unintuitive?

Little view is now brought to top of layout each time the big view runs
onDraw, if it's meant to be showing anyway. (It sometimes was hidden
after onCreate). Doesn't seem to have any adverse affect on speed.

Changed touchingPin check to use radius values from
MandelbrotFractalView rather than hardcoded to 20 (though constant is
still 20 for now).

Renamed crude rendering option. Might not satisfy Phil, can't remember
exactly how he wanted it phrased.

Removed all the logging I could find. Also changed radius check in
touchingPin thing because I'd forgotten that wasn't constant (now checks
the actual instance of the class).

Default Julia colouring scheme is now Yellow and Purple (as it was in
original web applet).
Happy with the menu layout now.
Added new icons (less squished). Not perfect but they'll do.
About to merge dev branch before publishing.
